info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 1 at 6:36PM CDT until April 2 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW THIS EVENING, WINTRY MIX OVERNIGHT...
.Band of wet snow will push north across the area through mid to late evening, dropping visibilities to 1/2 mile or less at times with accumulations on cold surfaces first, and then roads. A quick 1 to 3 inches of snow is possible in just 2 to 3 hours. The snow band is expected to lift north after midnight.
Overnight, snow is expected to become more of a wintry mix with light icing possible. The icing threat will linger into the mid morning hours of Wednesday.
Travel will be impacted quickly after onset of the heavier snow band as wet roads acquire a snow cover and snowfall rates severely hamper visibilities. Exercise caution or avoid travel if you can.
* WHAT...Snow this evening, wintry mix overnight. Snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...Clark and Taylor Counties.
* WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT WEDNESDAY
